mn-state-house.title: State House
mn-state-house.description: All 134 Minnesota House members are up for reelection every two years. You can find your district here. Most are uncontested. Not listed below are the primaries for a special state senate election for the St. Cloud-area seat of former state Sen. Michelle Fischbach, who resigned in May to assume the office of lieutenant governor. Republican Jeff Howe and DFLer Joe Perske are uncontested in their primaries and will face off in November.

mn-us-senate-class-2.title: Special
mn-us-senate-class-2.description: Sen. Tina Smith was appointed to this seat in January after Sen. Al Franken stepped down. The timing of his resignation triggered an off-cycle election for the seat. It will be up for election again in 2020.

mn-us-house-district-1.title: District 1
mn-us-house-district-1.description: Minnesota's southernmost congressional district includes Rochester, Faribault, Mankato and Albert Lea. DFLer Tim Walz held this seat for more than a decade before vacating it to run for governor this year.

mn-us-house-district-2.title: District 2
mn-us-house-district-2.description: Stretching southeast along the Misssissippi River from the Twin Cities' southern suburbs, the Second District includes Belle Plaine, Prior Lake, Northfield, Red Wing and Wabasha. Republican Jason Lewis is running for a second term as its congressman.

mn-us-house-district-3.title: District 3
mn-us-house-district-3.description: The Third District spans much of the outer west metro and includes Plymouth, Eden Prairie and Rogers. It has frequently been home to one of the nation's most expensive U.S. House races. As of the end of June, both Dean Phillips and Rep. Erik Paulsen had each spent about $1.3 million on their campaigns.

mn-us-house-district-4.title: District 4
mn-us-house-district-4.description: This east metro district includes St. Paul, Roseville, Woodbury and White Bear Lake. The district has been controlled by the DFL since 1949 and is currently held by nine-term DFL Rep. Betty McCollum.

mn-us-house-district-5.title: District 5
mn-us-house-district-5.description: Covering most of Minneapolis and the western inner ring suburbs, the Fifth District has been in DFL hands since 1963. Rep. Keith Ellison's decision to run for attorney general leaves this seat open for just the third time in the last 75 years.

mn-us-house-district-6.title: District 6
mn-us-house-district-6.description: The solidly Republican Sixth District sprawls northwest from the Twin Cities' outer ring suburbs to Stearns County, including St. Cloud, Delano, Crystal and Coon Rapids. Rep. Tom Emmer has represented it since 2015.

mn-us-house-district-7.title: District 7
mn-us-house-district-7.description: Encompassing much of the western half of the state, from the Canadian border to Marshall in the south, the Seventh is Minnesota's largest district. According to Cook Political Report, it is the most solidly Republican district in the nation currently represented by a Democrat, Rep. Collin Peterson.

mn-us-house-district-8.title: District 8
mn-us-house-district-8.description: Republicans view the Eighth District, historically a DFL stronghold that includes the Arrowhead region and much of the Iron Range, as one of their best pick-up opportunities in 2018 with the retirement of DFL Rep. Rick Nolan.

mn-governor.title: Minnesota Governor
mn-governor.description: The open governor's race got more interesting this spring when neither party's slate of candidates stuck with their endorsed candidate.

mn-attorney-general.title: Minnesota Attorney General
mn-attorney-general.description: After relatively-unknown Matt Pelikan won the DFL endorsement over incumbent Lori Swanson, she exited the race to run for governor, setting off a domino effect of other candidate filings. Among other things, this led to Rep. Keith Ellison throwing his hat in the ring, suddenly opening up his Fifth District congressional seat.
